page.title: 07Lound Church
page.content: The church of St. John the Baptist, Lound, was built in the 13th Century. The church in the past was busy. This does not seem to be the case today. The church is visited by a lot of tourists in coaches.The church is like a museum. People visit it for its font,rood screen and a modern painting of St. Christopher on the North wall. There aretoday only a couple of services a week and occasional weddings and christenings. There is a flower rota and a church cleaning rota. Collections are made for the C.O.F.E.children's society and pension fund. On the day we visited the church in June 1985,there was a notice announcing that Bishop Maurice Wood was retiring on the 26th August,the date of his 69th birthday. At the moment the church has two church wardens,a secretary and a treasurer. Coffee mornings are held occasionally.
